business.headline: World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende on global trade, AI, India's aspirationsWorld Economic Forum chief Borge Brende provided his in-depth analysis of critical global and economic and political dynamics and the impact of Donald Trump's return as US President will mean on trade policies.

Nykaa Fashion CEO Nihir Parikh steps down with immediate effectThe resignation is effective from the close of business hours on December 5, 2024, as per the company's regulatory filing with the BSE and NSE.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 5 straight sessions: Will bull run continue on D-Street?The rally comes amid anticipation of a dovish stance by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), fuelling momentum in Banking and Financial Services stocks.

Vishal Mega Mart to launch Rs 8,000 crore IPO: Check price band, other detailsVishal Mega Mart IPO: The IPO is entirely an Offer For Sale (OFS) by the promoter, Samayat Services LLP, which currently holds a 96.55% stake in the company.

What is PM-Vidyalakshmi Scheme: Check all key details The PM-Vidyalakshmi scheme offers financial support to students pursuing higher education in India, ensuring that deserving students have access to the education they need without financial barriers.

Swiggy share price hits 52-week high today. Will the positive momentum last?Swiggy share price: As the stock reaches new highs, analysts are raising concerns about whether this positive momentum will last. The sharp rally has prompted some to question the stock's sustainability at these elevated levels.
CRR cut in focus at RBI MPC meet: What it means for the economyThe CRR is the percentage of a bank's total deposits that must be maintained as reserves with the RBI. At present, it is set at 4.5%.

Sensex surges over 1,000 points: 3 factors behind bull run on stock marketStock market today: At 2:16 pm, the Sensex was up 977.80 to 81,937.20 points, while the NSE Nifty50 surged 274.55 to trade at 24,742.

Paytm share price hits 52-week high, up 185% in 6 months: More gains ahead?Paytm share price: The rally comes even as benchmark indices experienced sharp declines, with Paytm gaining 27% in the past month alone.

Stuck with a low CIBIL score? Fix it by following these 5 important stepsCIBIL (Credit Information Bureau India Limited) is a credit bureau in India that maintains credit records of individuals and businesses.

World Bank's $188 million loan nod for Maharashtra to develop backward districtsThe World Bank has approved a $188.28-million loan to stimulate economic growth in the Indian state of Maharashtra, especially in the lagging districts, a media release said.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Devendra Fadnavis back as Maharashtra Chief Minister, Shinde, Pawar his deputiesMaharashtra Chief Minister swearing-in ceremony: Devendra Fadnavis took oath as Chief Minister today. The ceremony was attended by PM Modi, top NDA leaders, noted industrialists, and the who's who of Bollywood film fraternity.

Case against Allu Arjun after woman dies in stampede during Pushpa 2 screeningA heavy crowd had rushed to the Hyderabad theatre to catch a glimpse of actor Allu Arjun, resulting in a stampede. A 35-year-old woman died during the incident.

India on border truce with China: Both sides positively affirmed implementationThe Ministry of External Affairs said that India and China had positively affirmed the implementation of the most recent disengagement agreement between the two countries.

Ghaziabad, Dehradun, now Rajasthan: Man who posed as multiple families' 'lost son'An emotional reunion of a long-lost son with his parents in Ghaziabad is turning into a nightmare for the family after reports emerged that the man had pulled the scam with several other families as well.

Victims of 'Sheikh marriages' narrate ordeal: Raped and abandoned, kept as maidIn Hyderabad, a disturbing trend has emerged where young girls are sold to wealthy Sheikhs from Gulf countries, called 'Sheikh marriages'. In this article, we delve into the ordeal faced by the victims and their families.

Affair with Hyderabad woman gets UK university vice-chancellor suspendedProfessor James Tooley, the vice-chancellor of the University of Buckingham, has been suspended after allegations of an affair with a young woman from Hyderabad. The woman, now in her twenties, claims she had a sexual relationship with the now 65-year-old professor. Tooley has denied the allegations.

How Amruta Fadnavis steals the show, online and offlineAmruta Fadnavis, the wife of Maharashtra CM, Devendra Fadnavis, is winning the hearts of millions on social media by sharing glimpses of her personal and professional life. Isro's PSLV-XL successfully deploys Proba-3, ready to unravel the SunThis mission complements India's ongoing Aditya L1 mission, which was launched in September 2023 and focuses on solar observations.

Shinde goes off script at oath ceremony, leaves red faces on stageShiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde while being sworn in as the Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra on Thursday went off the script and left dozens of red faces on the stage. He launched into a speech lauding PM Modi and the people of Maharashtra.

India's bedroom revolution: Sex toys are now just a Blinkit awayThe availability of sex toys on quick-commerce platforms like Swiggy, Blinkit, and Zepto marks a significant shift in India's sexual wellness landscape. It also highlights a broader change in societal attitudes.

Why Kerala's Malankara Christian factions are in a centuries-old power struggleThe longstanding feud between Orthodox and Jacobite factions continues to polarise Kerala's Malankara Christians, fueled by disputes over authority, property, and centuries-old theological differences.

Mystery of Flight 19: How Bermuda Triangle's secrets still puzzle investigators Bermuda Triangle is a name synonymous with intrigue, danger, and unsolved mysteries. Among its most haunting tales is the disappearance of Flight 19, a squadron of five Navy bombers that vanished into thin air on December 5, 1945. Decades later, the enigma persists.

Canadians blame Trudeau's government for strained ties with India: SurveyAmid diplomatic friction between Canada and India, a survey found the biggest chunk of Canadians at 39%, saying that the government of Justin Trudeau wasn't handling bilateral ties with New Delhi well. The poll found 39% of Canadians saying that they didn't believe Indo-Canadian ties could improve till Trudeau was the PM.

What's behind Asia's baby crisis?Elon Musk has highlighted a pivotal concern grappling Asian countries -- declining fertility rates and rise in ageing populations. NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
